Name: A Blaze in the Dark
QuestDesc: You witness a crime at the stroke of midnight. To your surprise, a familiar figure appears at the scene...

Chapters.Title: Take the Gondola and enjoy a relaxing day in Ragunna

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You board the Gondola and enjoy a pleasant day in Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As night falls over the city, you get off the Gondola and notice two suspicious figures nearby...

Chapters.Title: Investigate the suspicious figures attempting to enter the home

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's taking you so long?

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we don't bring back the goods, the boss will have our heads！

Options.PlotLineKey: Am I interrupting something?

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... Oi, best keep your nose out of our business. We're with the Black Alley.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Figure
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Idiot! {Male=He's;Female=She's} got the stance of a skilled fighter. We need to move!

Options.PlotLineKey: Who's there?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me, I… I need your help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Familiar Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, what's got you two running scared?
Huh?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A flurry of panicked sounds echo in the distance, and the sense of being watched fades.

Options.PlotLineKey: Zani?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}？

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know what these two were up to?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were babbling about "hostages" and "feints," and then they came at me.

Options.PlotLineKey: They were trying to break into someone's home.
Let's just say they forgot to bring their house key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And they just ran after taking one look at you, hm? Seems about right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thieves, you mean? I can imagine why they were fleeing like that.

Options.PlotLineKey: They said it was "Black Alley" business.
Have you heard that name before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have. But that name… it's already...

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You there! What's going on here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just two thieves. Took care of them. I was about to deliver them to the <te href=800005>Chamber of Discipline</te> myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about {Male=him;Female=her}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Same as you, drawn here by the sound of a scuffle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know the rules. I'll go with you, make the report, and be done with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me handle this. You'd rather not deal with their questions, hm?

Options.PlotLineKey: Someone else was also there. She asked for my help.
But she ran away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So there was somebody else...

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right, you'll come with me to the Chamber then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This might be more complicated than it looks. Will you wait for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This won't take long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the streets of Ragunna, you come across a group of thieves who claim to be from the "Black Alley." Before you catch up to them, Zani appears and stops them in their tracks. She proposes escorting the thieves to the Chamber of Discipline with the patrolling Acolytes and making a statement. Meanwhile, you decide to stay behind to investigate a mysterious person calling for help.

Chapters.Title: Look for the mysterious person calling for help nearby

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (While I wait for Zani, maybe I should search the area where that voice came from. )

Chapters.Title: Inspect the spot where the footprints end

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Looks like they left by Gondola...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The trail's gone cold. I'll wait for Zani to return.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here. Sorry to keep you waiting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm... those Chamber of Discipline folk are as difficult to deal with as ever.

Options.PlotLineKey: How did it go?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... you know how they are with the Montellis these days. No surprise they didn't share any interrogation details.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I told them the thieves claimed to be with the Black Alley, but the Chamber doesn't bother with rumors without solid proof.

Options.PlotLineKey: What exactly is the Black Alley?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A gang made up of criminals, although how many joined willingly is anyone's guess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A lot of vagrants were pressed into their service. Pawns in a game of crime.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The leadership got wiped out a few years ago by someone working solo. The leftovers? They were screwed. Some are still rotting in prison.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you think those two were just a few stragglers?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe. Or maybe they just wanted to spook you... but they picked the wrong person to mess with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're still thinking about that person who asked for help, huh? Got any leads?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Tell Zani what you discovered.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You think she's in the same boat as those vagrants in the past? Forced into something they didn't choose?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, {PlayerName}, you're the type who can't turn your back when someone asks for help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not too late. Got time for a detour?

Options.PlotLineKey: I've got time to spare, so where are we going?
Is it far from here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The old entrance to the Black Alley.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If they're crawling back from the ashes, we might find a clue or two at their old haunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You uncover some clues, but none lead you to the mysterious help-seeker. You decide to wait for Zani to return before continuing. After her return, she shares stories about a lone hero who single-handedly wiped out the Black Alley, a known criminal gang. This makes you suspect that the person might be connected to the Black Alley.

Chapters.Title: Head to the Black Alley's entrance
Head to the Black Alley's entrance

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is it. Just hit the right spot, and the trapdoor should open.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's on your mind?

Options.PlotLineKey: How come you're so familiar with this?
You're not quite the same as you were during the daytime.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm... I have some past experience...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, it's not work hours now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's focus on what's in front of us first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aside from a few broken rocks, only silence greets your efforts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange... my memory shouldn't be failing me, should it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who's causing trouble here?! Don't you know this is the Masked Brothers' turf?

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Little Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-Brother... they look tough...

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's there to be afraid of? We are the ones rebuilding the Black Alley!

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, how about you hand over some coin, eh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, that was a wasted trip.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Zani reach the entrance of the Black Alley, and attempt to unlock the trapdoor, but it won't budge. Right at that moment, two masked thugs confront you and announces their plans to rebuild the Black Alley before they attack you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, mercy! We were blind. Please just let us go this time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Little Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Told you, didn't I? Told you they were tough! Why do you never listen to me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Little Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this place cursed? Every time something happens, it's never good news.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Little Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like the last time...

Options.PlotLineKey: Hold on. Last time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, weeks ago. There was one hell of a racket. We thought the whole place was falling apart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turns out, it was a bloody terror of a woman. Saw us, didn't say a word, just pulled a blade on us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were lucky to get away. Took us two weeks to come back.

Options.PlotLineKey: She's the one who wrecked the entrance, then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps... but the real question is why.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... everything's good now, right? We'll just be on our way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quietly...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that all the nerve you've got? And you call yourselves the ones to bring back the Black Alley?

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well you got to have something to make folks fear you, right? One of you looks soft, and the other looks halfway worked to death... I liked my chances.

Options.PlotLineKey: Shame you picked the wrong one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How many times have you pulled this off?

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Big Brother
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not even once!!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Save the rest for the Chamber of Discipline.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Zani swiftly subdues the two would-be escapees.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I'll keep digging into the Black Alley and what happened today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll let you know when I have something.

Options.PlotLineKey: Okay.
You seem surprisingly motivated? That's not normal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, after handing over those other two thieves, I learned they were targeting Montelli staff residences.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Providing a safe working environment is part of my job description too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's getting late. We'll pick this up tomorrow, once I've got more to go on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After defeating the masked thugs, they reveal that the entrance to the Black Alley was destroyed by a ruthless woman weeks ago. Zani escorts them to the Chamber of Discipline and will reach out to you in the following day.

Chapters.Title: Return to Ragunna and wait to hear back from Zani

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You order some late night snacks at Trattoria Margherita and looks for a place to rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next day, you get a call from Zani as you're wandering on the street.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I've got some updates on the situation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The name of their leader—Talos.

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't know that name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm... that name should've died along with the Black Alley years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mentioned before that someone single-handedly wiped out the upper ranks of the Black Alley. Any idea who it was?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... the rumors call them... the "Blazing Nightwalker."

Options.PlotLineKey: Come again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Blazing Nightwalker. Ugh, don't make me say it again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're free, come by and we'll talk. There's something I could use your help with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You receive contact from Zani, informing you that the thugs are led by a woman named Talos, who was believed to have vanished with the Black Alley years ago. Zani also mentions that the rumored hero behind Black Alley's takedown is referred to as the "Blazing Nightwalker." She then suggests you meet her in the city. You can sense her hesitation when mentioning that name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something you wanted to talk about?

Options.PlotLineKey: Ask about the Black Alley.
Ask about Talos.
Ask about the Blazing Nightwalker.
That will be all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ragunna once went through a hell of a time. The Order was hit with major losses, including many of their best. The chaos lasted for quite a while.

Options.PlotLineKey: You mean... the Second Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The Order is by no means above reproach, but you cannot deny they keep Ragunna stable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Alley was born when that stability fell apart. Criminals from every corner banded together, and law-abiding citizens paid the price.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To make things worse, they forced a lot of vagrants into their ranks, using them as tools for their dirty work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their eyes and ears were everywhere. The Order tried several times to wipe them out, but each time they came up empty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then one day, the Chamber of Discipline managed to catch the ones pulling the strings—they were found tied up and served on a platter. That's when the Black Alley taken down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the Blazing Nightwalker... and Talos, that's the names the Black Alley gave them.

Options.PlotLineKey: I have another question.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Talos... that was what the Black Alley called their leader.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Word is, Talos might not even be a single person. Whoever is on top gets the title of "Talos."

Options.PlotLineKey: There must have been quite a few "Taloses" over the years.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right. They had a brutally efficient way of picking the leader. Whoever was the strongest got the crown.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this title should have died with the Black Alley.

Options.PlotLineKey: I have another question.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Blazing Nightwalker was just one of many dramatic titles around Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ragunna once went through a hell of a time. The Order was hit with major losses, including many of their best. The chaos lasted for quite a while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, nights weren't as quiet as they are now. There were always some poor civilians getting hassled by criminals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then someone elusive gradually caught people's attention. They took down those criminals and disappeared right after saving the civilians.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They never revealed their name, so the people started calling them the Blazing Nightwalker.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last time anyone saw them was when they took down Talos and the rest of the Black Alley higher-ups.

Options.PlotLineKey: I have another question.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Best to get some rest now. Work starts later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before getting some rest in, you decide to inquire Zani for more information about the case. Seeing that she has experienced past events, she might help you piece together some parts of the puzzle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which one should I pick?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I'll take all of them. One of each, please.

Options.PlotLineKey: A bit hard on digestion, no?
You ordered too much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, {PlayerName}, you made it. Let's sit over there and talk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wasn't sure what you liked. It was too hard to choose, so I just got one of each flavor.

Options.PlotLineKey: I took you for more of a coffee person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Work is bitter enough as it is. Why drink something bitter on top of that?

Options.PlotLineKey: Things not going well?
Those two thieves give you more trouble than expected?
I thought they promised you a vacation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah... Still about the stuff from last time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, a lot of the family's staff have been running into the same kind of trouble as that night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're not anything special on their own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What matters is... a lot of the family's employees have been running into the same kind of trouble as that night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A vacation is like an ad. Only the ones dishing it out have the power to make it real or fake.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And recently, a lot of the family's employees have been running into the same kind of trouble as that night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guess my vacation will just have to be postponed again.

Options.PlotLineKey: What if I help you apply for it next time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Maybe that could work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, where should we start?

Options.PlotLineKey: First, tell me what you need help with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I mentioned before, many people working for the Montellis have been victims of attempted thefts, like last night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family has tightened security, but just sitting here waiting won't solve anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the ones we caught... they haven't been chatty. Plus, they've only committed a few small-time crimes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it would be tricky to use... more extreme methods on them. If we do, it could give the wrong people a chance to twist the situation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mentioned someone asked for your help earlier, right?

Options.PlotLineKey: You want to locate her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've been trying but haven't found anyone who matches her description yet. She's probably keeping a low profile.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But right now, she might be the only lead we've got.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, might I ask you play your face card one more time?

Options.PlotLineKey: Seems it's up to me again.
For the ice cream, I guess I can't say no.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Much appreciated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe some more then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll do it tonight. It will be in your hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feel free to rest until it's time. I've already made arrangements at a hotel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know what. I'll be here for a while. If you have any questions, just ask away.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do I need to prepare anything?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything is taken care of.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You meet Zani near the ice cream cart in Ragunna. She shares with you that many of the Montelli family's staff have previously run into the same kind of trouble as that night. Zani asks for your assistance in locating the help-seeker, which is crucial to resolving the deadlock in this complicated case.

Chapters.Title: Head to Palazzo Agrotta and get some rest

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello there, {Male=Mr.;Female=Ms.} {PlayerName}

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ms. Zani has already reserved a room for you. Ready to check in?

Options.PlotLineKey: Have you heard of the Blazing Nightwalker?
I'm ready to check in.
I have other matters to attend to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've come to the right person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was once saved by the Blazing Nightwalker myself. Ragunna wasn't nearly as peaceful back then as it is now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was heading home later than usual when I ran into some Black Alley brutes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it hadn't been for the Blazing Nightwalker, I'm sure they would have robbed me blind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had an entire month's earnings on me!

Options.PlotLineKey: What does the Blazing Nightwalker look like?

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well… It all happened so quickly, and it was dark, so I didn't get a proper look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All I saw were a pair of blazing eyes. Guess that was where the name came from, eh?

Options.PlotLineKey: I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well, I'll show you to your room.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. You are always welcome to stay with us.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Should I head straight for the hotel, or dig a little deeper first?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You take some rest in your room. By the time you wake up, you realize you haven't slept much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, you leave the hotel and decide to wander around before the operation starts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}? It's not time yet. Aren't you going to rest a little longer?

Options.PlotLineKey: Aren't you?
Can't sleep anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am resting, alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm afraid I can't help you with that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Insomnia and I go way back.

Options.PlotLineKey: I have a few questions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about?

Options.PlotLineKey: The family's approach this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A lot of people were targeted, but in the end, they only sent you to handle it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we send too many people, we risk tipping our hand.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why not tell The Order?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, the Chamber of Discipline did catch a few perps, but they're not quick to act without solid proof.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... some of the higher-ups in the Order might just be happy to see the Montellis having a little trouble.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The biggest issue I find is...

Options.PlotLineKey: You actually volunteered for extra work?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? That's the biggest issue you find?

Options.PlotLineKey: There's probably something you're not telling me, isn't there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright... You've got sharp instincts. Spending too much time with you, and I'm running out of secrets.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was the one who delivered Talos and those Black Alley leaders to The Order.

Options.PlotLineKey: What?!
I knew it all along.
The Blazing Nightwalker... So is it the Rinascitan tradition to have a moniker?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, that's me... the Blazing Nightwalker. But honestly? I really don't want to keep repeating that name.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By tradition, shouldn't you have revealed your true identity at the end?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you're talking about the stories where, after a lot of hardship and misunderstanding, one side lets the truth out with their last breath, leaving the other to regret it forever?

Options.PlotLineKey: Where did you read that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've got my own ways to keep entertained.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hiding my true identity got old fast. Since you were curious, I might as well just tell you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, you're not someone I can't trust, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, as you have already known, I am the Blazing Nightwalker... though I really wish I didn't have to keep repeating that name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honestly, it's a bit of a burden...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and by the way, after you became the Laureate, they're giving you all sorts of monikers too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family sent me to handle this, partly because they didn't want a big operation to stir things up, and partly because... well, it was a strategic move.

Options.PlotLineKey: Hard for me to imagine you all fired up like that once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have to say it again, I never called myself that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, I was just doing what needed to be done. Never planned on picking up a fancy nickname.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's hard to imagine that name suiting you now.

Options.PlotLineKey: What happened?
Did work change you?
You seem to have lost a spark.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, that's what work does to you...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think this "Talos" is the real deal then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Not sure. Could just be the same old story repeating itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's call it a cleanup job.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If things go smoothly, maybe we can grab a late-night snack after, hmm?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll go all in then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't think this is serious enough to give it your all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just do enough to get it done. But keep some of that enthusiasm for the snacks later, hm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You wake up in the middle of the night and find it difficult to fall back to sleep, so you decide to take a walk. To your surprise, you run into Zani, who also struggles to fall asleep. As you chat away, you uncover her identity as the Blazing Nightwalker. Zani was the one who once defeated that formidable gang.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's almost time. Let's split up and prepare for the ambush.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see if we can catch them in the act.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Zani is clearly doing more than just "enough to get it done," but I'll hold off on mentioning it for now.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You wait on the roof for some time. As you anticipated, several suspicious men begin to appear.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone's making moves. But they just seem to be petty thieves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it. You're clear to act when you see fit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll watch your back and keep an eye out for anyone trying to shadow you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Thug
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Figured someone was waiting for us. But you walked right into it, didn't ya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Thug
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, boys! Let's put 'em down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Need a hand?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've got it covered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Thug
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... You hit harder than I thought...

Options.PlotLineKey: Stop resisting. Just surrender!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cocky Thug
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, my boss gave me this—!

Options.PlotLineKey: Zani.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's move in. Now!

Chapters.Title: Catch up with the fleeing gang members
Catch up with the fleeing gang members

Dialogues.Speaker: Panicked Thug
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Blimey, how the hell are you movin' so quick?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bakie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Beep*—*Beep*!

Options.PlotLineKey: Put Bakie down. Now!
Stop this pointless resistance!

Dialogues.Speaker: Panicked Thug
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not a chance! It's my hostage now... This is an Echonapping, you hear!

Dialogues.Speaker: Panicked Thug
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! Ain't no way you'll do somethin' stupid while I'm holding this Echo!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bakie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beep! Beep!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey! Don't be causing trouble for folks who need their breakfast bright and early.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, start talking. Where's your hideout? Who's the one really calling the shots?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like we'll have to drag him back. We'll get answers sooner or later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A shame this one's only good for squealing. He's not the one we're after.
Is it... me you're looking for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My name is Colleen... Please, help me and my friends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After defeating the gang members, one manages to escape and takes Bakie from Trattoria Margherita as hostage. Just when the situation seems dire, Zani arrives in time and takes him out. And the mysterious help-seeker finally reveals themselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before we go any further, shouldn't you explain who you are first?

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm from the Black Alley...

Options.PlotLineKey: So you are one of them too?
You don't exactly look like you're in the same business.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, no, no... The Black Alley is more than just the gang! It's the place too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The entrance to the Black Alley is shut. It's done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right, Talos destroyed it. But there's another way in...

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It used to be a home for vagrants like us. A few scraps, a couple of jobs... just enough to get by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But then she came, and it all went up in smoke...

Options.PlotLineKey: What did she do to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She came in claiming this place was hers since they owned it before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Told us, if we wanted to stay, we had to follow her rules. No other choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Steal, lie, cheat, rob... same as the old days. Give her your tribute, or... or you get a beating.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A fish that slipped the net...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sounds just like how the Black Alley ran things... But do people actually accept her as the acting Talos?

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some people did. They wanted to, you know? The ones with the dirty hands already. They were easy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the main reason is that no one can stand up to her...

Options.PlotLineKey: Is she that strong?
Why?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Colleen doesn't answer your question, instead she looks at Zani with a conflicted and wary expression.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll wait outside.

Options.PlotLineKey: No.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}？

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Colleen, if you can't trust my friend, then I can't offer you my help.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust goes both ways. You can't ask for help with one hand while holding a knife with the other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The operation is a wrap. Bring the ones we caught in and then everyone can call it a day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in Terminal
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it, Ms. Zani. Any leads on your side?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, nothing to report.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in Terminal
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, looks like we'll have to try again tomorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just us now. Anything else bothering you while I'm at it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Terminal... Talos also has a Terminal. It lets her transform into a powerful Echo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So that's it. You are worried the Terminal was supplied by someone from the Montelli family, aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why you doubt us and prefer to put your faith in a wayfaring Laureate, hm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's no need to apologize. You're a victim in this, with every right to be suspicious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So then, {PlayerName}, what do you think we should do?

Options.PlotLineKey: What's your take? It's your job, after all.
I can't ignore someone who's asking for help.
I want to see how powerful this Echo really is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Sigh*... Who told everyone to call it a day again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As an employee of the Montelli family, I have an obligation to stop any Terminals from being misused.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll just have to ask the boss for double overtime pay and an extra vacation after this.

Options.PlotLineKey: Great, but have you spent the vacation you got last time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you really bringing up something so depressing now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, thank you both!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mysterious help-seeker, Colleen, admits she is from the Black Alley, a place that was once home to the homeless but is now seized by Talos and her gang. Colleen warns that Talos possesses a Terminal of unknown origin. You and Zani are determined to stop Talos from exploiting its power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Talos has us blindfolded whenever we leave the Black Alley. Keeps us from knowing the new entrance. A runner takes us to the meeting spot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll take you to him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's his hideout. Over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's a slippery one. One wrong move, and he'll be gone, off in a Gondola before you can blink.

Options.PlotLineKey: We can use that to our advantage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like we're thinking the same thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll cause a distraction up front. Leave the show to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you'll move to checkmate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Following the plan, you move to the rear of the hideout. You signal Zani to initiate the operation once in position.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Same as usual. Just another day's work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The runner's men rush out in an attempt to overwhelm Zani with their numbers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meanwhile, you intercept the runner attempting to flee.

Dialogues.Speaker: Runner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, wait! Wait, wait! You're after the Black Alley's entrance, aren't you?

Options.PlotLineKey: I haven't said a word yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Runner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know my value to people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Runner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that you've got me, no point in resisting. The longer I hold out, the more pain I'm asking for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Runner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Smart people know when to give in. It's how I stayed alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, have you got him?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yeah, and he's already talking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So we won't need to "help" him talk after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once he coughs up the entrance location, we'll head straight there from here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family is almost on site. They can handle the cleanup.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the description the runner provided, you find the Black Alley's entrance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Might be a bit late to ask, but… Colleen, you did what Talos asked, didn't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you forget what {PlayerName} said? Trust goes both ways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I… I didn't have a choice! If I didn't, they'd... they'd...you know, hurt me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then when the time comes, make sure you tell the Chamber of Discipline everything. No lies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But… but I…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't excuse yourself by saying you were forced into it. Can you do that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine... I get it.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Blazing Nightwalker is no joke.
Giving someone a lecture? Are you sure you're Zani?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, don't call me that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Believe me, I'd kill to be in a bed right now instead of standing out here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's get this over with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm praying it doesn't reek in there.

Options.PlotLineKey: Please don't point that out right now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. It may be an underground waterway, but it's been abandoned for a long time now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not exactly clean, but it's livable. We did some work on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The pipes are a maze, though. They split up the territory by rank...

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Talos is holed up somewhere deep in the waterway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Demons always live in hell, like the Primus always stays in the Cathedral." Yeah, that's about right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and {PlayerName}, masks on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mask makes things a lot easier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's better if neither of us gets recognized too easily.

Options.PlotLineKey: Fair point, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Colleen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: H-hey… I'll pretend I don't know who you are!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guess I don't need to spell it out for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Following the runner's route, you locate the hidden entrance to the Black Alley and confront Talos to put an end to this once and for all.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Black Alley (Fast Travel available on the map)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, that's the real story behind that ridiculous name.

Options.PlotLineKey: I thought it would be a more elaborate story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not everything needs to be turned into some grand tale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this city, it's mostly the same routine every day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How long can I snooze before I'm late...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which time's best to line up to get a fresh wrap...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How to sleep without lying in bed for hours...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These little routines are fragile. One bad move and they're gone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But likewise, just one bold move is enough to bring them back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most people got it wrong, slapping that big name on me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just part of my routine. Like snoozing, eating, or keeping my hair and horns in check.

Options.PlotLineKey: So, is taking down an entire gang also part of it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was alone back then. I didn't even bother hiding who I was.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that's when the trouble started to find me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought, why wait for it to get worse? Better to finish it quickly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But of course, I made it worse... Too fast, too soon.

Options.PlotLineKey: So how did you deal with it back then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli family reached out to me and offered to clean up the mess. Even said they'd back me up in the future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, I changed jobs. The work is the same. No difference.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Disappointed?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your instincts came from a good place. A fist might not be as sharp as a blade, but it can still break through deeply rooted problems.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And up close, it's gentle enough to protect what's important.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So don't let today bother you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I'm not letting it bother me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cleaning up simple scum doesn't weigh on me.

Options.PlotLineKey: So what you said back there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just reliving some old memories, that's all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you're right about something...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you said just now applies to you, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The difference, though, is that you are a blade. A weapon that can break the cycle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you don't seem to realize it. Seeing you has brought some old feelings back to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't you see? Ever since you helped make the Carnevale happen, Ragunna's been different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Things are busier now. There's more work, more opportunities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I told you before that these routines are fragile. One bad move and they're gone, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... a stable environment is the only way to reduce the bad moves. That's the way we get to keep our routines.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tried to do that for a long time, but you're the one who made it happen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With fewer bad actors on the streets these days, <ano=The Blazing Nightwalker>I</ano>... am increasingly irrelevant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps one day, I'll finally be able to sleep through the night.

Options.PlotLineKey: So, a few nights ago, you were also...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. It was all part of the routine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been thinking... It's a relief that someone like you is willing to step up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your potential is probably beyond what anyone can imagine...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet, you still insist on being responsible for everything, no matter how big or small.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. You've done well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, sorry... It's just a habit...

Options.PlotLineKey: It's okay.
I'll take it if I can return the favor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Okay.

Options.PlotLineKey: Ruffle her hair.
Touch her horns.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright... that's enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, you didn't say you were going to do that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, this is for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It used to be my weapon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can take it as a token of silence, or as part of an agreement.

Options.PlotLineKey: An agreement to do just enough to get it done?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, as if I'd do that! That would just be getting in your way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What made an ordinary Montelli employee become a hero with a dramatic alias? Was it for fame, a commitment to justice, or a desire for excitement in a ordinary life? Perhaps the truth lies deeper beyond...
